name: NSVS 14256825
scenarioDescription:
The NSVS 14256825 Exoplanetary System

NSVS 14256825 is a star with 0.42 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.19 times its radius. It is located 2734.20 light years away from the solar system.

NSVS 14256825 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

NSVS 14256825 b

NSVS 14256825 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 3.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3225.00 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, NSVS 14256825.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.12, which means that when NSVS 14256825 b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 2.75 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 3.49. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of NSVS 14256825 b is 4497.02 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, NSVS 14256825 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system NSVS 14256825, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
